title: Ticket #6531: $Ff segfaults
description:
Specifying e.g. an executable with $Ff immediately segfaults on submit. Example file: 
Universe = vanilla
Requirements = (Target.OpSys == "LINUX") && \
               (((Target.OpSysMajorVer == 6) || (Target.OpSysMajorVer == 7)) && \
                (IsBuildSlot =!= true))
Executable = $Ff(../../usr/bin/env)
Request_CPUs = 1
Request_Memory = 512MB
Request_Disk = 256MB
Queue 1
remarks:
2018-Jan-17 15:02:22 by johnkn:
Turns out that in 8.6, all $F(var) macros crash when var is a literal rather than the name of a submit variable. so this works: 
filename = ../usr/bin/env
Executable = $Ff(filename)
but this will crash 
Executable = $Ff(../usr/bin/env)

2018-Mar-08 15:53:40 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: Looks good.

2018-Mar-09 11:16:00 by tim:
